required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Role of Oxygen for Vascular Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: Role of Acute and Chronic Hypoxemia for Vascular Function

lead_sponsor.agency: Klinik für Kardiologie, Pneumologie und Angiologie

brief_summary.textblock:
Hypoxemia may contribute increased morbidity and mortality in COPD patients. We aim to characterize the role of acute and chronic hypoxemia for vascular function. For this purpose we measure capillary oxygen concentration and vascular.
Vascular function is assessed by flow-mediated dilation oft he brachial artery, forearm blood flow and laser doppler perfusion imaging.
We hypothesize that hypoxemia leads to impaired vascular function.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional

primary_outcome.measure: Flow-mediated dilation of the brachial artery

secondary_outcome.measure: Intima-media thickness of the brachial artery
Fractional diameter change of the brachial artery
Endothelium-independent vasodilation of the brachial artery

study_pop.textblock: CAD patients with or without COPD; healthy volunteers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- stable coronary artery disease
- stable chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute myocardial infarction within 30 days
- acute exazerbated COPD within 30 days
- aucte infections
- severe acute or chronic renal failure
- severe heart failure
- atrial fibrillation
- severe cardiac arrhythmia
- hypotension
- active malignant disease
- active rheumatic disease
- pulmonary hypertension with vasoactive therapy

overall_official.affiliation: Division of Cardiology, Pulmonary Disease and Vascular Medicine
